channel.title: Enum on learn ▷ play ▷ write
channel.description: Recent content in Enum on learn ▷ play ▷ write

item.title: Day 2 - Diving in...
item.description: Since last night I’ve been playing with some of Elixir’s data structures, mostly lists, tuples and maps. While I’m not new to these data structures, the way Elixir’s API is laid out is a little different and took awhile to get used to. The syntaxes for list and tuple seemed intuitive enough, [1, 2, [3, 4]] is a list, {91, 23} is a tuple. With maps it was a little different, %{"key" => "value"} or %{keyThatsAtom: "value"}.
